intro: Glaucium luteum var. fimbrilliferum, commonly known as the yellow hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, rayed flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its medicinal properties have been historically noted, though it contains toxic alkaloids.
